posts.text:
Tók þetta af bimmerforums.com

Glæsilegt í alla staði

Every now and then I come across something truly impressive.  This represents some of the work of Extreme Tuners in Athens, Greece, and the name is no joke.  Pushing limits requires funds and skill, and these guys have both.  All they do is build and tune engines.  The entire lengthy discussion can be found here (http://forums.evolutionm.net/evo-dyn...ne-2007-a.html), but unless you feel like reading quite a few pages of posts, I'll post the highlights here.

FWIW, this is some of what they've done:

2006 - N/A ford cosworth 4cylinder 16v engine 119cui: 416hp -11,900rpms
2007 - Ford cosworth 4cylinder 16v Turbo engine 120cui: 1280hp 47psi (custom triple ball bearing 80mm turbo 119lbs/min)
2007 – Mitsubishi Evo 8 4g63 4cylinder 16v Turbo engine:  1416hp – 57psi (custom quad ball bearing 82mm turbo 132lbs/min)

So, getting 700whp/L from 2.0L @ 8500rpm is no small feat, but what do you need if you get bored and want to shoot for 2000whp?


Cast Garrett compressor wheels (right) tend to come apart above 50 psi. CNC billet aluminum wheels (middle) are stronger, but why not be different and use your own CNC billet titanium (left) compressor?




You'll need a turbo big enough for the job, which in this case is a 108mm twinscroll T4 turbo, with custom quad ball bearing CHRA and 100psi capability.








To get enough airflow at 12,000rpm(!) to get the job done, you'll need a skillfully ported head, complete with titanium valves and copper-beryllium valve seats:








And you're going to need a set of camshafts to handle the rpm and withstand tremendous ramp pressures, so why not a set of hollow titanium billets with DLC at only 234 grams each?









And since there is no aftermarket rod up to the task, just ask for a set of billet mmcs-titanium connecting rods at 286g each. Rod/Stroke ratio is 2.07:






For pistons, a set of custom beryllium pistons with DLC fits the bill, and since methanol is the fuel, 13:1 SCR is fine:







A strong piston pin is needed as well:






Toss in a custom titanium billet crank:





A set of 9000cc/min injectors:




And since a factory 4G63 block probably wouldn't hold up, just CNC machine your own from billet aluminum:






No head gasket is used:




And to put all that power to the gearbox, one needs a suitable multiplate clutch:




Yes, it is smaller than a cam gear:






An example of very efficient turbo manifold design from one of their recent projects:






And last but not least, a dynosheet from this car, running 'only' 48psi and hydraulic cams:
fokk.

Þetta er helvíti myndarlegt.

Hvernig er það þegar menn nota enga heddpakkningu, er heddið þá bara klemmt þeim mun fastar á blokkina?

Þetta er insane rugl .........<<<naughty.gif>>>

If you look at the dyno chart, it crosses the 200whp mark around 4650rpm, which is actually pretty quick spooling for what it is.  It makes so much power that the lines look vertical, but they wanted to make it 'quick spooling', so they did a good job.

Straight methanol stoichiometry is 6.4:1 as opposed to 14.7:1 for gasoline, so a very high volume, high pressure fuel system is needed.  And since 130 octane methanol doesn't 'knock', tuning in those netherworld regions is tricky. 

Since some of you are wondering what this costs, I know the Ti rods are around $3250 each, and the Ti crank is around $31,000.  They are now working on a CNC billet cylinder head and carbon fiber turbine housings.  These guys have good connections with F1 parts fabricators.

If you want a turbo, they'll build whatever you want, and their quad BB center sections are damn strong.  GM's 1400whp Ecotec project used one of their 80mm turbos:


If you can dream up a turbo, they can build it:





They also use straight metal matrix composite (mmc) rods, which are lighter than Ti.  The problem is cost and life (120 hours).  These use no rod bearing.



Not often that one sees 13:1 compression ratio beryllium pistons, much less in a turbo engine:





Ti valves and CuBe seats sure are pretty:



Some other cars laying around the shop:

1360whp 2.0L Escort Cosworth







1070whp Subaru on its way to 1500+whp:



Anyway, it just takes desire, skill, money, and maybe a kidney.
DAMN!
Hehehe hef skoðað þennan aðeins, enn 13:1 í þjöppu er svo vangefið hahahah og sveifarásinn 31.000 usd! og rot 3250 stk!! foookkkk

uuu NICE!

sææææææææææææææælll!!! þetta er insane stuff

þetta er maaagnað, en vá turbo laggið í svona bínu - væri gaman að prufa þetta.
það tekur því að byrja á þessu!
Haha nice... Ekki slæmt að hafa hugvitið í þetta og peningana.
ætlann spóli
Þeir nota O-hringi væntanlega
Það er hvorki fræst rás í blokkina né heddið svo þeir virðast ekki vera að nota o-hringi

Það er einmitt það sem ég tók eftir. Þess vegna datt mér í hug að þeir væru bara með þetta planað í einhverja fáránlega speca og svo klemmt virkilega fast saman.

Þeir hljóta að geta fundið almennilega pinna og rær í heddið miðað við budgetið.
bara ef maður gæti verið að taka þátt í einhverju svona væri draumur
vaaaááá þetta er truflaðslega flott smíði hjá þeim ! bara gaman að sjá þetta

Mér finnst þetta eiginlega lykta meira af eiturlyfjapeningum heldur en færni.
Þetta er flott, svona á sama hátt og gullhúðaður Escalade.
shjiiiiiiitt þetta er geðsjúkt <<<icon_biggrin.gif>>>
wtf, er hægt að nota stimpilstangir með engum stangarlegum?
Þetta er roSSalegt, er ekkert video ?
Þekkirðu eitthvað til
greinilega, en stendur líka þarna að líftíminn á þeim er ekki nema 120 klst <<<icon_smile.gif>>> sem að er enginn rosa keyrsla sko

hvað kemur það smíðinni við ?

þetta er flott smíði sama hvaðan peningarnir koma

bíddu.... er eitthver ROSALEG kreppa þar eða ? <<<icon_biggrin.gif>>>

en shit það er eins gott að gæjinn sem tjúnar kunni sitt fag... dýrt spaug ef að allt fer til fjandans á eitthverju test runni
svo true
kromo likes this
Váááá það væri DRAUMUR að gera þetta !!!!!!!!

Ég hef svosem ekki öruggar heimildir fyrir því hvaðan peningarnir koma, en þetta er Grikkland og multi milljón króna sveifarás. Ég hef annars bara eitt að segja, að ef þessir guttar ætluðu að impressa einhvern með því að dæla tug milljóna í mótorinn þá þurfa þeir að búa til meira power en kanarnir sem eru að búa til sama powerið á ódýrum fjöldaframleiddum pörtum, ekki bara jafn mikið power.
Ég set líka mínar efasemdir við þennan að þeirra sögn 1200 hestafla Cosworth YB mótor, og þeir sem hafa yfir höfuð skoðað heddin á svona mótor vita hvað ég meina.

Er ekki kunnugur þessu

en Magnús,, ZORBA hér á spjöllunum og er Grikki þekkir þessa náunga .. og er einnig á því að afltölurnar sé frekar RÚMAR vs raunveruleikinn

en þetta TITAN dót er alveg magnað

Sorry as i will write in english.....my icelandic are still nowhere to be found.
As Alpina said i know a couple of these guys.
Money spent on cars in Greece can get crazy.
The owner of the Mitsubishi in the following video is known as the most famous street racer in Greece.
He was one of the first in Europe to run a 600+bhp Cosworth in the late 80s as a street car. Back then these were crazy numbers and i remember him racing a Yamaha 1000 FZR in 89.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7aMZMPFVvTM

As for BHP number this is relative.
You can not have a comparison between two cars that are in different location and were dynoed by different people. Simple things as changing temperature or height from sea level or other simple factors like that on the dyno can give big differences.
It is necessary to know the following .... Humidity (temperature versus relative humidity), Barometric Pressure, elevation and temperature. And in order to compare two cars these have to be identical. If you change say elevation by a few meters your values will be different.

On top of that please note that cars that run 9sec runs in Greece do not do it on proper 1/4 mile tracks. In fact i would say the kvartmila track here in Iceland is waaaaaaay better than any track in Greece.
I am sure that 8 sec runs would be possible by many of these guys easily on a proper track.
As for manufacturing of parts in Greece there are a few guys that make their own parts and yes they are very very good.
Remember that even car dealers offer tuned cars like the Subaru Impreza 1.6 Turbo with factory warranty there.
Greeks love their cars and there are some serious cars down there.
I believe a Greek Lancia still holds the world record in both power and 0-400 time.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5fheILNz4fU

Here is a fiat Uno that runs 9 sec:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3opUtd4Hyh0

Here is a 106 Rallye that reaches over 300km ( claimed 560bhp):
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t8Dtp...eature=related
Here it is accelarating:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c5JGj...eature=related

BTW he has done over 50000 km with this engine with no problems!

and here is a 1000bhp Rx7 running a stroked RB26
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bV_UF...eature=related

Last but not least here is a Nissan Sunny with a claimed bhp of over 900 that races a 911 Turbo tuned by 9ff
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B0fs_nX5Ge0&NR=1

I know this car is fast cause he completely destroyed my friends F430 in Greece.
My friend said that he was leaving him for dead from 120km and over.....

All these cars are build and tuned in Greece and most parts on them re custom made there.
Bara flott Magnus<<<icon_cool.gif>>>
Þetta er vangefið!
þetta er eitthvað það ruglaðasta sem ég hef séð!
